summary: Part 12[[MORE]] Rob and Y/n decided to announce their pregnancy as soon as they were able, no one thought that their baby was...
caption:
Part 12

Rob and Y/n decided to announce their pregnancy as soon as they were able, no one thought that their baby was not his but his mother was surprised that she fell pregnant so quickly. She accepted the news before congratulating the pair at becoming parents, since their marriage Y/n and Rob had grown closer and were doing their best at making their arrangement work. They had yet to be intimate but Rob did not want to push her into something that she was not ready for.

Meanwhile Ned Stark had been escorted to Castle Black after the celebrations, it had been too hard for the family to say goodbye to their father not sure whether they would see him again. It was Lannister soldiers who led him to the wall, much to their disgust. The family that had held their father prisoner and almost taken his head, Rob wanted revenge for how his father was treated for speaking the truth. He wanted to expose the Lannisters for what they truly were, liars.

Ned was able to ride his own horse to the wall but his every move was watched by guards, he was not sure if his son Jon was aware that he was to take the black. No one would have believed that he had fallen so far, but he was attempting to expose the same secret as Jon Arryn but he was lucky and Arryn was not. He hoped that his eldest son Rob would be able to control his temper and not start a war with the Lannisters, he did not want his son’s head on the block. With Sansa safe from Cersei and her son, rumours had circulated that Joffrey was to have a new bride but no one had been named. Since the news had been share that Joffrey may not be the true heir to the Iron Throne Stannis and Renly began to lay claim to the throne. 

Mention of war had began around Westeros and men of the north were curious if Rob Stark would choose a side and if he would go to their aid. Nothing more was said of the situation and hoped that Rob would stay out of it.

When he arrived at Castle Black, Ned Stark was escorted inside of the grounds with the gate closing quickly behind without any chance of escape. There was no returning home to his family, he hoped that in this life or the next he would see them again.

He was not surprised however to find Jon waiting there for him, as Ned slowly climbs down from his horse he makes his way over to him as he stands patiently waiting for Jon to say something he is moved when Jon crushes him with an embrace.

‘Father’

‘Jon’

‘How was your journey?’

‘Long especially with Cersei’s hired guards to ensure I reached castle black’ Ned replies.

‘I am sorry that you have been forced to come here’

‘It is not your fault Jon, I tried to expose the Lannisters and almost paid with my life. If it was not for Y/n, I would not be here breathing’

‘Y/n? She saved your life?’

‘She did as well as your sisters’ 

‘Where is she Y/n? Is she in King’s Landing? Did she escape?’ Jon asks quickly.

‘Jon a lot has happened since you left for the wall, a lot that needs to be said, I need to rest and then I will tell you everything’

Jons eager to know everything, he is pleased to see that his father is alive but it still shocks him to the core that he was forced to give up his position at Winterfell for the wall but he knew that his brother Rob would make his father proud. Jon shows his father to the main hall to rest near the fire, the winters are growing colder and making life at the wall harsher. After some ale and a warm meal in his stomach, Ned feels ready to tell his son about Y/n.

‘Y/n is alive Jon?’

‘Where is she?’

‘After negotiating with Joffrey, she had to make a deal in order for our family to face no consequences of what had come to pass’

‘I don’t understand’ Jon tells him as he tries to get comfortable on the wooden bench.

‘Jon I am sorry to tell you this but she had to marry Rob’

‘Rob, my brother?’

‘Yes. I understand that you came to care for y/n and she for you?’ Ned asks as he can see the pain etched on Jon’s face.

‘I love her’

‘Aye and she loves you but she did what she had to do to save our family’

‘Why did she have to marry Rob? she could have said no’

‘She had no choice Rob or it would have been all of our heads including Sansa and Arya’ Ned informs him ‘But there is another reason why Y/n married your brother’

‘What was it?’

‘Jon she is carrying your child’

Jon’s eyes widen, shocked at the information that his father is giving him.

‘My…my child…but….but’

‘Jon Y/n confided in me about what had happened between you, if people had learnt of her indiscretion she would have been cast out and left to fend on her own, with no money or title’

‘Does Rob know?’

‘He does, Y/n talked before their marriage and it was agreed between Rob and I that people believe that the child is his own’ Ned answers ‘I am sorry Jon but it is for the best, the Lannisters would have your head if they knew’

‘I don’t care. Why didn’t she tell me?’

‘She did not wish for the news to get in the wrong hands, Y/n does not know that I am telling you this but you have a right to know’

‘I understand, I just wish she was mine and I had taken her with me when we had the chance’

Ned places his hand onto Jon’s shoulder, hoping to console him but he looked broken.

@disneyprincessbuffyannesummers

@ego-allie-bap

blog.name: lady-griffin
blog.title: LadyGriffin's Home
blog.description: A bad idea written down is far better and far more useful to you than a blank sheet of paper and a mythical piece of brilliance that has been stuck in your head out of fear of failure. Go ahead and fail. Then make it better.

tags: A song of ice and fire
summary: Jon’s Resurrection and Reunion with Sansa
title: Jon’s Resurrection and Reunion with Sansa
body:
I’ve been reading some Jon Fire Wight theories and explanations and I came across one that was quite excellent by @occupyvenus – HERE. 

An excellent read that I highly recommend.

But to summarize, many have guessed that Jon warged into Ghost before he died and thus his soul is there not on other side, so when Melisandre brings him back, he will be a-okay. 

Which doesn’t ring true for me personally. GRRM has brought up how he thinks coming back from death should be a traumatic experience and the character should be affected by it. Just having Jon warging into Ghost to escape the potential consequences, doesn’t seem like GRRM.

The theory by @occupyvenus, brings up the fact that while Jon will be better and far more functioning than Drogo, Beric and Stoneheart, he won’t be the old Jon. And definitely will have more than physical scars from the experience.

After having his soul in Ghost for so long (and being murdered), he will be traumatized and more beast than man.

So if that is true, than this new Jon might become very violent and aggressive, a wild animal. More wolf than man. Beast!Jon. 

This brings in Sansa.

In the show Jon and Sansa are reunited after Jon is resurrected, it seems more than likely that will be the case for the books as well. However, this time Jon will be less ‘human.’

I think in many ways Sansa will be the one to bring Jon back from that darkness, maybe not exactly heal him, but do far more than anyone else can at The Wall.

We have seen that despite everything Sansa has gone through, she has still retain her kindness. We have also seen that Sansa’s courtesies have an effect on people, from the Hound to Tyrion to Kevan and Lancel Lannister. 

We also have the fact that Lady was the kindest and sweetest wolf out of the pack, which might just be a reflection of Sansa’s soul, but also a reflection of Sansa relationship with Lady. 

Sansa’s overall gentleness can have a profound effect on people (and ‘beasts’) and I think Jon will be no different.

However, Jon won’t instantly be better the second he sees Sansa. Far from it. 

In fact, I think their first interaction will be very bad and potentially violent.


First, Melisandre saw Sansa coming to Jon – a girl cloaked in grey on a dying horse.

Many readers and Jon himself believe that vison was of Arya, but it’s not.

However, Melisandre might not know that. If she tells Beast!Jon that his beloved sister Arya has returned to him, but it’s not Arya, that only spells trouble from my perspective. Especially if Beast!Jon is violent, confused and lost.

Or even if someone says ‘your sister’ is here, Jon might just immediately think of Arya (maybe he even forgot Sansa). 

Secondly, Jon has mistaken a red head for being Ygritte before.

Jon thought Melisandre was Ygritte and as soon as he sees a red head his mind goes straight to Ygritte.

So here we have a very beautiful red-head being mistaken by Beast!Jon’s lost love, who might not have all his senses or control with him.

Now, while I said this interaction will be violent and bad – I don’t think it will be as bad as some of you might be thinking.

I can imagine the scene being tense and there being an overall element of the threat of sexual violence, but aside from a forced kiss – I doubt GRRM will go any further than that.

Thirdly, Memory is a tricky thing

Depending on how the warging + potential blood magic will affect Jon being reborn with fire, his memory might be greatly damaged to only potentially scrapped.

Beric has been losing himself, piece by piece. And while Lady Stoneheart might “remember,” she has also forgotten so much.

Jon not remembering Sansa seems more than likely to me. 


ON one hand, very bad for Sansa who just wants to be reunited with her family and be loved. This interaction might be a combination of Lysa trying to kill Sansa and Loras forgetting Sansa at the tourney’s hand. So not a great experience  for Sansa. – Which fits with the whole aspect of Sansa thinking it would be so sweet to see Jon again (to clarify Sansa thinking it will be so sweet, makes me think, it will not – or at the very least be bittersweet). 

ON the other hand, past Jon might have never had feelings for his half-sister (cousin) or even thought of it, but if this Jon’s “first memory” and “meeting” with Sansa is her being a very pretty red-head whose being nice and kind to him and is overall very loving.

Poor Jon is going to be so screwed, so screwed. 

As several Jonsa posts have pointed out, Jon is not oppose to nice and pretty things, far from it. 

Many people have said that Jon would want a warrior woman, but I disagree, Jon definitely wants an ideal domestic life. And now that he’s being murdered, I think Jon will want that even more. 


Now, there is this fantastic Meta post about Beauty and the Beast and GRRM on Tumblr that I cannot find. 

Update: @timeforvvolves found the Meta BATB Sansa Arc I was talking about by @lady-in-a-song. And you can check out her Meta Analysis here - Part I, Part 2, Part 3. 

Now this analysis loosely connects to my own theory and more inspired and made me strongly consider the Beast!Jon aspect. However, you should still check out the meta anyway. 

Basically, GRRM is not exactly a fan of the well-known story that we all know and generally love and he prefers the original or the Cocteau’s tale (definitely not Disney). As the original Cocteau tale (and other adaptations) is all about consent and understanding, rather than a pretty lady healing an angry and violent beast. 

Which is why the Meta continues that Sandor despite the very common and popular theory, is not the Beast to Sansa’s Beauty, but a foil. The same goes for Tyrion. Their relationships are not adaptations of BATB but juxapositions for Sansa’s real ‘Beast’ to her ‘Beauty.’  

Sidenote: I imagine that Jon and Sansa’s relationship will focus on them talking and sharing everything together, forming a genuinue bond and deep connection. And similar to Beauty in the Cocteau tale, Sansa will have the power of consent in their relationship. 

Now, in my view (which could be wrong), GRRM doesn’t so much hate the popular Beauty and the Beast tale, but rather doesn’t see it as romantic as others do.

So, while I could be wrong about resurrected Jon and Sansa’s reunion – GRRM might use their less than great first introduction as a potential parallel of BATB, but not so much as a romantic aspect, but a way to make their story more dark and twisted.


There are seeds for a very bad and violent first meeting already placed in the books, but also the potential growth for some very complicated and ‘dark’ romantic beginnings. 

Which to me definitely seems like it fits with GRRM bittersweet ending, while Jon and Sansa reuniting isn’t the end to the story, I think it will be the beginning of the end.

In fact, I think their first interaction will be very bad and potentially violent.


First, Melisandre saw Sansa coming to Jon – a girl cloaked in grey on a dying horse.

Many readers and Jon himself believe that vison was of Arya, but it’s not.

However, Melisandre might not know that. If she tells Beast!Jon that his beloved sister Arya has returned to him, but it’s not Arya, that only spells trouble from my perspective. Especially if Beast!Jon is violent, confused and lost.

Or even if someone says ‘your sister’ is here, Jon might just immediately think of Arya (maybe he even forgot Sansa). 

Secondly, Jon has mistaken a red head for being Ygritte before.

Jon thought Melisandre was Ygritte and as soon as he sees a red head his mind goes straight to Ygritte.

So here we have a very beautiful red-head being mistaken by Beast!Jon’s lost love, who might not have all his senses or control with him.

Now, while I said this interaction will be violent and bad – I don’t think it will be as bad as some of you might be thinking.

I can imagine the scene being tense and there being an overall element of the threat of sexual violence, but aside from a forced kiss – I doubt GRRM will go any further than that.

Thirdly, Memory is a tricky thing

Depending on how the warging + potential blood magic will affect Jon being reborn with fire, his memory might be greatly damaged to only potentially scrapped.

Beric has been losing himself, piece by piece. And while Lady Stoneheart might “remember,” she has also forgotten so much.

Jon not remembering Sansa seems more than likely to me. 


ON one hand, very bad for Sansa who just wants to be reunited with her family and be loved. This interaction might be a combination of Lysa trying to kill Sansa and Loras forgetting Sansa at the tourney’s hand. So not a great experience  for Sansa. – Which fits with the whole aspect of Sansa thinking it would be so sweet to see Jon again (to clarify Sansa thinking it will be so sweet, makes me think, it will not – or at the very least be bittersweet). 

ON the other hand, past Jon might have never had feelings for his half-sister (cousin) or even thought of it, but if this Jon’s “first memory” and “meeting” with Sansa is her being a very pretty red-head whose being nice and kind to him and is overall very loving.

Poor Jon is going to be so screwed, so screwed. 

As several Jonsa posts have pointed out, Jon is not oppose to nice and pretty things, far from it. 

Many people have said that Jon would want a warrior woman, but I disagree, Jon definitely wants an ideal domestic life. And now that he’s being murdered, I think Jon will want that even more. 


Now, there is this fantastic Meta post about Beauty and the Beast and GRRM on Tumblr that I cannot find. 

Update: @timeforvvolves found the Meta BATB Sansa Arc I was talking about by @lady-in-a-song. And you can check out her Meta Analysis here - Part I, Part 2, Part 3. 

Now this analysis loosely connects to my own theory and more inspired and made me strongly consider the Beast!Jon aspect. However, you should still check out the meta anyway. 

Basically, GRRM is not exactly a fan of the well-known story that we all know and generally love and he prefers the original or the Cocteau’s tale (definitely not Disney). As the original Cocteau tale (and other adaptations) is all about consent and understanding, rather than a pretty lady healing an angry and violent beast. 

Which is why the Meta continues that Sandor despite the very common and popular theory, is not the Beast to Sansa’s Beauty, but a foil. The same goes for Tyrion. Their relationships are not adaptations of BATB but juxapositions for Sansa’s real ‘Beast’ to her ‘Beauty.’  

Sidenote: I imagine that Jon and Sansa’s relationship will focus on them talking and sharing everything together, forming a genuinue bond and deep connection. And similar to Beauty in the Cocteau tale, Sansa will have the power of consent in their relationship. 

Now, in my view (which could be wrong), GRRM doesn’t so much hate the popular Beauty and the Beast tale, but rather doesn’t see it as romantic as others do.

So, while I could be wrong about resurrected Jon and Sansa’s reunion – GRRM might use their less than great first introduction as a potential parallel of BATB, but not so much as a romantic aspect, but a way to make their story more dark and twisted.


There are seeds for a very bad and violent first meeting already placed in the books, but also the potential growth for some very complicated and ‘dark’ romantic beginnings. 

Which to me definitely seems like it fits with GRRM bittersweet ending, while Jon and Sansa reuniting isn’t the end to the story, I think it will be the beginning of the end.

“He likes that word,” Jon said, smiling. 
“An easy word to say. An easy word to like.” 
“King,” the bird said again. 
“I think...
body:
“He likes that word,” Jon said, smiling.
“An easy word to say. An easy word to like.”
“King,” the bird said again.
“I think he means for you to have a crown, my lord.”
“The realm has three kings already, and that’s two too many for my liking.” Mormont stroked the raven under the beak with a finger, but all the while his eyes never left Jon Snow.

 - AGOT

H o w did I nOT notice this before ohmygod. Foreshadowing since the second book??

title: coming home | jonsa
body:
jonsa. fluff. domestic au. canon divergence. rated g. 

The sound of her laughter helping him take his mind off the demands of being the King in the North.  "I wouldn’t have to chase you around if you come to me willingly.“

"Jon, stop! Stop!” Sansa shrieked in childish delight as she ran around the garden near the main house of the Stark compound. Jon just came back from a month-long trip to Kings Landing and today had been his first day back home. 

They both knew he was faster and could have easily caught up with her if he wanted to but Jon was enjoying this rare time alone with his wife. The sound of her laughter helping him take his mind off the demands of being the King in the North. “I wouldn’t have to chase you around if you come to me willingly." 

She shook her head at her smirking husband, his eyes shining with a devilish glint that made her go weak in the knees. The Lady of Winterfell loved this playful side of him and she knew she was the only one privy to see it. As a young girl, she hadn’t entertained the idea of falling for her father’ squire but now Sansa couldn’t even imagine her life without Jon.

Keep reading

summary: We will call this place our home, The dirt in which our roots may grow. Though the storms will push and pull, We will call this...
caption:
We will call this place our home,
The dirt in which our roots may grow.
Though the storms will push and pull,
We will call this place our home.

We’ll tell our stories on these walls.
Every year, measure how tall.
And just like a work of art,
We’ll tell our stories on these walls.

Let the years we’re here be kind, be kind.
Let our hearts, like doors, open wide, open wide.
Settle our bones like wood over time, over time.
Give us bread, give us salt, give us wine.

A little broken, a little new.
We are the impact and the glue.
Capable of more than we know,
We call this fixer-upper home.

With each year, our color fades.
Slowly, our paint chips away.
But we will find the strength
And the nerve it takes
To repaint and repaint and repaint every day.

Smaller than dust on this map
Lies the greatest thing we have:
The dirt in which our roots may grow
And the right to call it home.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=byHSQoemFvI

body:
If this means nothing I’m dead 😵 👋🏻

“Let me tell you something about wolves, child. When the snows fall and the white winds blow, the lone wolf dies, but the pack survives. Summer is the time for squabbles. In winter, we must protect one another, keep each other warm, share our strengths.”

summary: We are excited to announce this new and awesome project: Jonerys Monthly Prompts. With this project, we look forward to creating...
body:
We are excited to announce this new and awesome project: Jonerys Monthly Prompts.

With this project, we look forward to creating new content and keep the tag active during and after s8.

This is how it works:

Every month we’ll publish a different fic prompt in the following categories:

  • Fluff
  • Smut
  • Angst
  • Au

You are allowed to write one-shots and drabbles. If you want more info please contact us and you can also request prompts here. You can also send prompts you would like to see, we’ll publish it so it can

And now the first one of hopefully many prompts:

                                            Forbidden 

Remember you must tag: #jonerysmonthyprompts and #jonerysfics 

Note: We really thank @therebelcaptainnetwork for allowing us to use the monthly prompts format.
